_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: GitHub Actions
author: raymond@reflexian.com
description: Allows your to host your GitHub Self-Hosted Action runners on Pterodactyl

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

apt update
apt install -y curl jq tar node-shasum libdigest-sha-perl expect

# Download dependencies
ARCH=$([[ "$(uname -m)" == "x86_64" ]] && echo "linux-x64" || echo "linux-arm64")

# Get download URL

LATEST_JSON=$(curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/actions/runner/releases/latest")
RELEASES=$(curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/actions/runner/releases")

awk '{print length($1), $1}' | sort -nk 1 | head -1

if [ -z "${VERSION}" ] || [ "${VERSION}" == "latest" ]; then
    TEMP_DOWNLOAD_URL="$(echo ${LATEST_JSON} | jq .assets | jq -r .[].browser_download_url | grep -i ${ARCH} | awk '{print length($1), $1}' | sort -nk 1 | head -1)"
    DOWNLOAD_URL=${TEMP_DOWNLOAD_URL:4}
else
    VERSION_CHECK=$(echo ${RELEASES} | jq -r --arg VERSION "${VERSION}" '.[] | select(.tag_name==$VERSION) | .tag_name')
    if [ "${VERSION}" == "${VERSION_CHECK}" ]; then
        TEMP_DOWNLOAD_URL="$(echo ${RELEASES} | jq -r --arg VERSION "${VERSION}" '.[] | select(.tag_name==$VERSION) | .assets[].browser_download_url' | grep -i ${ARCH} | awk '{print length($1), $1}' | sort -nk 1 | head -1)"
        DOWNLOAD_URL=${TEMP_DOWNLOAD_URL:4}
    else
        echo -e "defaulting to latest release"
        TEMP_DOWNLOAD_URL="$(echo ${LATEST_JSON} | jq .assets | jq -r .[].browser_download_url | grep -i ${ARCH} | awk '{print length($1), $1}' | sort -nk 1 | head -1)"
        DOWNLOAD_URL=${TEMP_DOWNLOAD_URL:4}
    fi
fi

curl -sSL ${DOWNLOAD_URL} -o runner-linux.tar.gz
tar xzf runner-linux.tar.gz

sed -i 's/user_id=`id -u`/user_id=1/g' ./config.sh

./config.sh --unattended --url ${GITHUB_URL} --token ${GITHUB_TOKEN} --name ${RUNNER_NAME}

echo "-----------------------------------------"
echo "Installation completed..."
echo "-----------------------------------------"
